Class SubscriberServiceTestITCase

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.test.context.testng.AbstractTestNGSpringContextTests
org.springframework.test.context.testng.AbstractTransactionalTestNGSpringContextTests

All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, org.testng.IHookable, org.testng.ITestNGListener
@SpringBootTest @TestPropertySource(locations="classpath:application-integration.properties") public class SubscriberServiceTestITCase extends org.springframework.test.context.testng.AbstractTransactionalTestNGSpringContextTests
Integration tests for SubscriberService.

  • Method Details

    • loadTestData

      @BeforeMethod public void loadTestData()

    • testGetSubscriberById

      public void testGetSubscriberById()
      Test getSubscriberById when the subscriber exists.

    • testGetSubscriberByIdNotFound

      public void testGetSubscriberByIdNotFound()
      Test getSubscriberById when the subscriber does not exist.

    • testGetSubscriberByIdSamlIdentifiers

      public void testGetSubscriberByIdSamlIdentifiers()
      Test getSubscriberById when the subscriber exists and is associated with SAML identifiers.

    • testGetSubscriberByIdOidcIdentifiers

      public void testGetSubscriberByIdOidcIdentifiers()
      Test getSubscriberById when the subscriber exists and is associated with OIDC identifiers.

    • testCreateSubscriber

      public void testCreateSubscriber()
      Test createSubscriber.

    • testUpdateSubscriberName

      public void testUpdateSubscriberName()
      Test updateSubscriberName when the subscriber exists.

    • testUpdateSubscriberNameNotFound

      public void testUpdateSubscriberNameNotFound()
      Test updateSubscriberName when the subscriber does not exist.

    • testDeleteSubscriber

      public void testDeleteSubscriber()
      Test deleteSubscriber. Note, this subscriber is not associated with any subscriptions. If it were then this operation would fail due to the foreign key in the database.

    • testDeleteSubscriberIdentifiers

      public void testDeleteSubscriberIdentifiers()
      Test deleteSubscriber when the subscriber is associated with OidcIdentifier and SamlIdentifier objects.

    • testDeleteSubscriberNotFound

      public void testDeleteSubscriberNotFound()
      Test deleteSubscriber when the identified subscriber does not exist. No exception should be thrown in this situation.

    • testSetSamlIdentifiersReplace

      public void testSetSamlIdentifiersReplace()
      Test setSamlIdentifiers when the subscriber is already associated with some SAML identifiers but not OIDC identifiers. The existing SAML identifier collection should be replaced.

    • testSetSamlIdentifiers

      public void testSetSamlIdentifiers()
      Test setSamlIdentifiers when the subscriber is not already associated with some SAML identifiers but is associated with OIDC identifiers. The SAML identifiers should be created and the OIDC identifiers unmodified.

    • testSetSamlIdentifiersNotFound

      public void testSetSamlIdentifiersNotFound()
      Test setSamlIdentifiers when the subscriber doesn't exist.

    • testSetOidcIdentifiers

      public void testSetOidcIdentifiers()
      Test setOidcIdentifiers when the subscriber is not associated with SAML or OIDC identifiers. There are two OIDC identifiers, and the OIDC identifier with issuer https://auth.open.ac.uk is associated with two claims, one of which includes a claim name that doesn't already exist in the system.

    • testSetOidcIdentifiersSameIssuer

      public void testSetOidcIdentifiersSameIssuer()
      Test setOidcIdentifiers when the subscriber is not associated with SAML or OIDC identifiers. There are two OIDC identifiers both with issuer https://accounts.google.com but with different claims. This test verifies both OIDC identifiers are persisted due to not being equal.

    • testSetOidcIdentifiersReplace

      public void testSetOidcIdentifiersReplace()
      Test setOidcIdentifiers when the subscriber is not associated with SAML identifiers but is associated with OIDC identifiers. The OIDC identifiers should be replaced.

    • testSetOidcIdentifiersNoClaims

      public void testSetOidcIdentifiersNoClaims()
      Test setOidcIdentifiers when the subscriber is not associated with SAML or OIDC identifiers. There is one OIDC identifier that has no associated claims. This will result in an IllegalArgumentException because an OidcIdentifier must be associated with at least one claim.

    • testSetOidcIdentifiersNotFound

      public void testSetOidcIdentifiersNotFound()
      Test setOidcIdentifiers when the subscriber doesn't exist.

    • testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifier

      public void testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifier()
      Test getSubscriberBySamlIdentifier when one matching subscriber is found.

    • testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifierMultiple

      public void testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifierMultiple()
      Test getSubscriberBySamlIdentifier when multiple matching subscribers are found.

    • testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifierNone

      public void testGetSubscriberBySamlIdentifierNone()
      Test getSubscriberBySamlIdentifier when zero matching subscribers are found.

    • testGetSubscriberIdBySubscriberName

      public void testGetSubscriberIdBySubscriberName()
      Test getSubscriberIdBySubscriberName when a subscriber is found.

    • testGetSubscriberIdBySubscriberNameNotFound

      public void testGetSubscriberIdBySubscriberNameNotFound()
      Test getSubscriberIdBySubscriberName when a subscriber is not found.
